citation.article-title: Thermomonas haemolytica gen. nov., sp. nov., a gamma-proteobacterium from kaolin slurry.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Thermomonas haemolytica sp. nov.
Thermomonas haemolytica (hae.mo.ly«ti.ca. Gr. n. haema blood; Gr. adj. lyticus dissolving, loosening;
The Gram-negative, rod-shaped cells are 1.0-12.5 μm long x 0.5-0.8 μm wide.
The cells are motile by means of polar monotricheous flagellation or are non-motile.
Colonies on complex standard media at 50°C are whitish/translucent (at 37 °C they are transparent), circular, smooth and convex with an entire edge.
Growth occurs in the temperature range 18-50 °C, optimum growth occurring between 37 and 50 °C.
Nitrate is not reduced, and the cells give negative results in the methyl red/Voges-Proskauer test and are negative for citrate utilization, and indole and H2S production.

DL-3-Hydroxybutyrate and L-leucine are assimilated. pNP-α-D-glucopyranoside, pNP-phenyl-phosphonate, 2-deoxythymidine-5′-pNP-phosphate, L-alanine-pNA, L-glutamate-γ-3-carboxy-pNA and L-proline-pNA are hydrolysed.
Compounds that are not assimilated or hydrolysed by any of the strains are listed in Table 1.

The strains are positive in the tests for the enzymes alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase (C8), lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, phosphatase acid and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and urease activity, and show strong β-haemolytic activity.
Some strains assimilate acetate, propionate, cis-aconitate, L-malate, mesaconate, oxoglutarate, pyruvate, L-alanine, L-aspartate, L-phenylalanine, L-proline and L-serine, and hydrolyse gelatin.
The G+­C content of the DNA is 67.1-68.7mol%.
The chemotaxonomic properties and other characteristics are as for the genus.

The type strain, T. haemolytica A50-7-3T, has been deposited at the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen and the Culture Collection of the Laboratorium voor Microbiologie, Universiteit Gent under the accession numbers DSM 13605T (=LMG 19653T).
Other strains of this species are T. haemolytica B50-7-1 (=DSM 13598=LMG 19655), T. haemolytica B50-8-1 (=DSM 13599=LMG 19654) and T. haemolytica D50-7-1 (=DSM 13610=LMG 19656).
The strains were originally isolated from kaolin slurry used in the production of paper.
